definition[0]: if you give someone a makeover, you make them look more attractive by giving them new clothes, a new hairstyle etc
definition[1]: if you give a place a makeover, you make it look more attractive by painting the walls, putting in new furniture etc
example[0]: It’s time we gave the kitchen a makeover.
definition[2]: a process of making big changes to a product or company to improve its image and encourage more people to buy the product or invest in the company
example[1]: As part of a makeover this year, the company appointed a new chairman.
example[2]: Analysts have pointed to the sliding sales of the brand and say it needs a completemarketing makeover.
